page_title: Angelic Hierarchy - The Nine Choirs - Christian Mythology

internal.text: üî•1. SeraphimThe Burning OnesSix-winged beings who cry "Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord of hosts!" (Isaiah 6:3). They surround God's throne in perpetual worship, burning with love for God. One touched Isaiah's lips with a live coal, purifying him.Biblical Source:Isaiah 6:1-7Function:Worship, purification, divine love

üõ°Ô∏è2. CherubimThe GuardiansFour-faced beings with four wings, guardians of sacred things. Stationed at Eden's gate with flaming swords. Support God's throne-chariot in Ezekiel's vision. Represent divine wisdom and knowledge.Biblical Source:Genesis 3:24, Ezekiel 1, 10Function:Guardianship, wisdom, protection of holiness

üëÅÔ∏è3. Thrones (Ophanim)The Wheels of JusticeLiving wheels covered with eyes, symbols of God's omniscience and justice. They are the instruments by which divine judgment is carried out. Called "galgalim" in Hebrew tradition.Biblical Source:Ezekiel 1:15-21, Daniel 7:9Function:Divine justice, authority, stability

üëë4. Dominions (Kyriotetes)The LordshipsRegulate the duties of lower angels and ensure the universe operates according to divine will. They represent God's sovereignty and majesty. Through them, God's dominion is manifested in creation.Biblical Source:Colossians 1:16, Ephesians 1:21Function:Regulation, divine authority, cosmic order

‚≠ê5. Virtues (Dynameis)The StrongholdsChannel divine power into creation, working miracles and signs. Grant courage to saints and heroes. Control the elements and movements of stars. Associated with grace, valor, and divine strength.Biblical Source:Ephesians 1:21, 1 Peter 3:22Function:Miracles, fortitude, grace

‚öîÔ∏è6. Powers (Exousiai)The AuthoritiesWarrior angels who fight against evil spirits and maintain spiritual boundaries. They prevent demons from overthrowing the world and keep the cosmos safe from chaos. The border patrol of the spiritual realm.Biblical Source:Ephesians 6:12, Colossians 1:16, 1 Peter 3:22Function:Spiritual warfare, protection, order

üèõÔ∏è7. Principalities (Archai)The RulersGuide and protect nations, kingdoms, cities, and large groups. Oversee the rise and fall of civilizations according to divine providence. They protect the Church and faithful communities.Biblical Source:Daniel 10:13, Ephesians 3:10, Colossians 1:16Function:National guidance, earthly authority, protection of institutions

üìØ8. ArchangelsThe Chief MessengersSent on missions of greatest importance. Announce major revelations and divine interventions. Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael lead this order. They are God's special envoys for crucial moments in salvation history.Biblical Source:1 Thessalonians 4:16, Jude 1:9Function:Major revelations, divine missions, leadership

üëº9. AngelsThe MessengersMost numerous and closest to humanity. Guardian angels belong to this order. They deliver everyday messages, provide protection, guide souls, and assist humans in their daily struggles. The most familiar angelic order.Biblical Source:Matthew 18:10, Hebrews 1:14, Psalm 91:11Function:Individual guardianship, messages, daily guidance
